dublinCore.dc:title: 109 HR 3259 IH: REAL ID Eligibility for Ukraine Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Quigley (for himself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Kaptur, and Mr. Bucshon) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability

form.official-title: To make nationals of Ukraine who are present in the United States eligible for REAL ID benefits, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the REAL ID Eligibility for Ukraine Act or the RIDE for Ukraine Act.
Section 401(b) of the Additional Ukraine Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2022 (8 U.S.C. 1101 note(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (2), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
a driver’s license or identification card under section 202 of the REAL ID Act of 2005 (division B of Public Law 109–13; U.S.C. 30301 note), notwithstanding subsection (c)(2)(B) of such Act.
